data.title: CrossFit MINS Workout
data.text: Workout of the Day 26.10.2025 WODDAILYSWEAT For Quality 6 Rounds 3:00 Row/Ski Erg 20 Box Stepups 15 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (24/16) 10 Ring Rows Sweat: 16/8 Train: 20/12 Compete: 24/16"
data.full_text:
Workout of the Day

26.10.2025

WOD
DAILYSWEAT


For Quality
6 Rounds
3:00 Row/Ski Erg
20 Box Stepups
15 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (24/16)
10 Ring Rows


Sweat: 16/8
Train: 20/12
Compete: 24/16"

ai_explanation.explanation:
Workout Overview


Hey everyone! Todayâ€™s WOD is all about quality and endurance, focusing on building strength and stamina through a series of movements that will challenge your entire body. Weâ€™ll be doing 6 rounds of rowing or skiing, box step-ups, kettlebell sumo deadlift high pulls, and ring rows. The goal here is to maintain good form throughout each round while keeping a steady pace. Letâ€™s break it down step by step!


---


Workout Components


1. Row/Ski Erg (3:00)

**Technique Steps:**

  • **Rowing:**
  • Start by sitting on the rower with your feet secured in the foot straps.
  • Grip the handle with both hands, arms extended, and lean slightly forward from your hips.
  • Push through your legs, lean back slightly, and pull the handle towards your chest, keeping your elbows close.
  • Reverse the motion by extending your arms, leaning forward, and bending your knees to return to the starting position.

  • **Ski Erg:**
  • Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and grip the handles.
  • Engage your core and pull the handles down towards your hips while simultaneously bending your knees slightly.
  • Return to the starting position by extending your arms overhead.

    • **Form Tips:**

  • Keep your back straight and core engaged to avoid rounding your spine.
  • For rowing, focus on using your legs to drive the movement, not just your arms.

    • **Scaling/Modifications:**

  • If youâ€™re new to rowing, consider reducing the time to 2:00.
  • For Ski Erg, you can also perform a seated row with a resistance band if equipment is limited.

    • ---


    2. Box Step-Ups (20 reps)

    **Technique Steps:**

  • Stand facing the box with feet hip-width apart.
  • Step up with one foot, pressing through your heel to lift your body onto the box.
  • Bring your other foot up to meet the first, standing tall at the top.
  • Step back down one foot at a time and repeat.

    • **Form Tips:**

  • Keep your chest up and engage your core throughout the movement.
  • Ensure your entire foot is on the box to maintain balance.

    • **Scaling/Modifications:**

  • Use a lower box if youâ€™re not comfortable with the height.
  • You can also perform step-ups without weights to focus on form.

    • ---


    3. Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (15 reps)

    **Technique Steps:**

  • Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, kettlebell on the floor between your feet.
  • Hinge at your hips and bend your knees to grab the kettlebell with both hands.
  • Drive through your heels, extending your hips and knees while pulling the kettlebell up to your chin, keeping your elbows high.
  • Lower the kettlebell back down to the floor and repeat.

    • **Form Tips:**

  • Keep your back flat and chest up during the lift.
  • Use your legs to initiate the movement, not just your arms.

    • **Scaling/Modifications:**

  • Use a lighter kettlebell if youâ€™re new to this movement.
  • If kettlebells are not available, you can substitute with dumbbells.

    • ---


    4. Ring Rows (10 reps)

    **Technique Steps:**

  • Set the rings at a height that allows you to lean back comfortably.
  • Grab the rings with an overhand grip and walk your feet forward until your body is at an angle.
  • Pull your chest towards the rings while keeping your body straight, then lower back down.

    • **Form Tips:**

  • Keep your core tight and avoid sagging your hips.
  • Focus on pulling with your back and arms, not just your shoulders.

    • **Scaling/Modifications:**

  • If rings are too challenging, you can perform inverted rows using a barbell at waist height.
  • Alternatively, you can do bent-over dumbbell rows.

    • ---


    Loading and Rep-Modification Options


  • **Sweat:**
  • Row/Ski: 2:00
  • Box Step-Ups: 16/8 (lower box)
  • Kettlebell: 16/8
  • Ring Rows: 8 reps

  • **Train:**
  • Row/Ski: 3:00
  • Box Step-Ups: 20/12
  • Kettlebell: 20/12
  • Ring Rows: 10 reps

  • **Compete:**
  • Row/Ski: 3:00
  • Box Step-Ups: 24/16
  • Kettlebell: 24/16
  • Ring Rows: 10 reps

    • Strategy Advice:
  • Focus on maintaining a steady pace throughout the workout. Itâ€™s better to keep moving than to go all out and burn out early.
  • Break up the movements into manageable sets if needed, especially on the kettlebell high pulls and ring rows.
  • Remember to breathe and stay hydrated!

    • ---


    Alright team, letâ€™s get after it! Keep your form tight, listen to your body, and most importantly, have fun! Letâ€™s crush this WOD together! ðŸ’ª

combined_content.title: CrossFit MINS Workout
combined_content.workout_text:
WOD:

For Quality

6 Rounds:

  • 3:00 Row/Ski Erg
  • 20 Box Step-ups
  • 15 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (24/16)
  • 10 Ring Rows

    • Sweat: 16/8

    Train: 20/12

    Compete: 24/16
